author: SANDIP DIGHE
description: Heavy rainfall caused the Kalu river to swell, stranding 300 trekkers, including 100 women, in the Malshej Ghat forest. A seven-hour rescue operation involving forest staffers and locals successfully brought the trekkers, mainly from Hyderabad, Mumbai, and Pune, to safety using ropes and ziplines.
title: Adventure turns terror: 300 trekkers, including 100 women, rescued

author: PARTH SHASTRI
description: In a harrowing incident following the AI 171 airplane crash, eight-month-old Dhyaansh and his mother, Manisha, suffered severe burns. Manisha's courageous act of saving her child led to both enduring extensive treatment, including skin grafts for Dhyaansh. The dedicated medical team at KD Hospital provided specialized care, ensuring their recovery and eventual discharge, highlighting the strength of a mother's love and medical expertise.
title: AI crash: Mum’s skin grafts help heal infant’s 36% burns

author: TNN
description: Amritsar Police successfully busted a Pakistan's ISI-backed smuggling network, arresting five individuals and seizing a significant cache of arms, ammunition, and drug money. The operation intercepted an AK Saiga rifle, Glock pistols, ammunition, and Rs 7.5 lakh intended for Nav Pandori, an associate of gangster Jaggu Bhagwanpuria. Preliminary investigations revealed direct links between the arrested individuals and Pakistan-based operatives.
title: Arms seized from ISI-backed gang in Punjab

author: BHARTI JAIN
description: The Election Commission of India announced a potential exclusion of 6.6 million names from Bihar's draft electoral roll. These exclusions are due to electors registering in other states, being deceased, permanently shifting, or failing to submit required forms. The EC emphasized the "overwhelming participation" in the special intensive revision, with over 72 million forms submitted.
title: Bihar's draft poll roll may exclude 66 lakh names: EC

author: TNN
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi lauded the CRPF's crucial role in national security, particularly in internal security challenges, on the force's 87th Raising Day. Home Minister Amit Shah commended the CRPF's selfless sacrifice and courage in combating Naxalism. Home Secretary Govind Mohan assured the CRPF of the Home Ministry's commitment to providing modern weapons and technology to address increasing security threats.
title: CRPF personnel made a mark by their duty, courage, says PM on Raising Day

author: TNN
description: The Delhi High Court has denied bail to Mohd Rizwan Ashraf, a suspected ISIS member accused of procuring arms and ammunition and using social media to promote the organization's goals. The court upheld the trial court's detention order, emphasizing that it was not a routine decision.
title: Delhi HC rejects bail of suspected Isis member in arms case

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Michael Wolff has stirred controversy by alleging Jeffrey Epstein played a role in introducing Melania Trump to Donald Trump. Wolff claims Melania was involved in Epstein's social circle and connected through Paolo Zampolli. Melania denies this, saying she met Trump at the Kit Kat Klub. Despite Trump's attempts to distance himself, photos and Epstein's claims suggest otherwise.
title: Did Epstein introduce Melania to Trump? Biographer makes bold claim

author: RAJ SHEKHAR JHA
description: A joint operation by Rajasthan and Maharashtra police, along with the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB), dismantled a drug cartel operating from a buffalo barn in Barmer, Rajasthan. Authorities seized drugs and equipment worth Rs 50 crore, including Mephedrone and Ketamine, from the Barmer site and Raigad, Maharashtra. The investigation revealed a network of clandestine labs and led to multiple arrests, highlighting the NCB's efforts to combat synthetic drug manufacturing.
title: Drug lab in buffalo barn busted, Rs 50cr drugs, tools seized

author: AMBIKA PANDIT
description: Opposition parties in India are raising concerns about the Election Commission's special intensive revision of Bihar's electoral rolls, alleging it could disenfranchise marginalized communities. They question the potential exclusion of 66 lakh people and criticize the rejection of certain documents. The Election Commission defends the process, urging parties to submit claims and objections during the designated period.
title: EC must stop SIR, says opposition; calls it ‘exercise of exclusion’

author: ALIM SHAIKH AND GITESH SHELKE
description: Eknath Khadse's son-in-law, Pranjal Khewalkar, and six others were arrested in Pune during a raid on a Kharadi apartment. Police seized cocaine, marijuana, hookah pots, and liquor. Khewalkar, along with the others, faces charges under the NDPS Act and COTPA, with the court granting police custody until Tuesday as investigations continue into potential drug sources and networks.
title: Ex-Maharashtra mantri kin, 6 others held in Pune drug party bust

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Donald Trump claimed on Sunday that he intervened to settle the India-Pakistan ceasefire, reiterating a past assertion while discussing conflict between Thailand and Cambodia. He stated he warned the prime ministers of Thailand and Cambodia that trade deals hinged on ceasing hostilities. Trump suggested his intervention prevented a potential conflict between India and Pakistan.
title: 'I settled India-Pak, now it's Thailand-Cambodia'; Trump credits trade pressure, calls it 'honour'

author: SANJAY KHAJURIA
title: J&K SIA narco-terror chargesheet exposes Pakistan plot

author: RAM SUNDARAM
description: A Chennai hospital and gynaecologist have been held liable for negligence after a premature baby lost all five fingers on his right hand to gangrene. The district consumer disputes redressal commission found that a cervical pessary procedure, performed without informed consent or adequate justification, triggered a chain of events leading to the baby's premature birth and subsequent complications.
title: Newborn loses 5 fingers in operation sans parents’ consent

author: TNN
description: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge stated he lacks information regarding Jagdeep Dhankhar's resignation as Vice President, suggesting it's a matter between Dhankhar and Prime Minister Modi. Kharge noted Dhankhar's consistent support for the government and his reluctance to allow discussions on farmer issues, poverty, and social injustices in the Rajya Sabha.
title: Only Dhankhar, PM Modi know real reason behind VP’s exit: Mallikarjun Kharge

author: OMER FAROOQ KHAN
title: Pakistan tribal council threatens highway block over girl’s murder

author: NASEER GANAI
description: PDP reaffirmed its commitment to self-rule in J&K, advocating for cross-border trade and eased travel with PoK, aiming for a dignified resolution to political conflicts. Irtiqa Mufti, daughter of PDP President Mehbooba Mufti, delivered the message, emphasizing the party's founding principles of dignity, dialogue, and democratic rights for the people of J&K.
title: PDP reasserts self-rule demand, fields Irtiqa in key role on foundation day

author: ABHISHEK CHOUDHARI AND CHAITANYA MARPAKWAR
description: Amidst speculation of a Shiv Sena (UBT) and MNS alliance for upcoming civic polls, Raj Thackeray visited Uddhav Thackeray at Matoshree on his birthday, marking a rare reunion. The cousins spoke for 20 minutes, with Raj paying tribute to Bal Thackeray. This visit, following Uddhav's hints of a reunion, fuels speculation of a political alliance, though some downplay its significance.
title: Raj visits Matoshree after years on Uddhav b’day, calls him Sena chief

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Los Angeles Rams coach Sean McVay was recently spotted enjoying a sunny getaway with his wife, Veronika Khomyn, in Saint-Tropez, France. The couple relaxed on a private yacht, soaking up the sun and picturesque views. This vacation serves as a restful break for McVay before he returns to lead the Rams' 2025 training camp.
title: Sean McVay in France: Secret yacht trip with wife — off-season break stirs online buzz

author: SANJAY KHAJURIA
title: Throat slit by banned Chinese manjha, biker dies in Jammu

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Travis Kelce, the Kansas City Chiefs' star, is seen at training camp with a new buzz cut. The change from his longer summer hair is creating a buzz among fans. A photo posted online ignited a debate. Some fans like the new look. Others miss his old hairstyle. Kelce is preparing for the NFL season and his upcoming movie.
title: Travis Kelce sparks internet frenzy with viral new haircut at Chiefs training camp

author: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA
description: The Supreme Court has ruled that trial courts cannot directly entertain complaints seeking police investigation of cognisable offences. Before approaching a court, individuals must first seek FIR registration with the jurisdictional police. Magistrates should direct informants to approach the officer-in-charge and then the Superintendent of Police before considering applications under Section 156(3) of the CrPC.
title: Trial court not the first stop for investigation, says Supreme Court

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A stabbing attack at a Traverse City Walmart injured 11 people before bystanders intervened. Derrick Perry, identified by family and locals, is being hailed as a hero for drawing his licensed weapon and holding the suspect, Bradford James Gille, at gunpoint. Perry, along with a former Marine who used a shopping cart, stopped Gille until police arrived, preventing further harm.
title: Watch: Hero bystanders stops Walmart stabber; Derrick Perry holds attacker at gunpoint

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Aaron Rodgers has addressed Terry Bradshaw's criticism of the Steelers signing him. Bradshaw had called the move a "joke," but Rodgers responded respectfully, acknowledging Bradshaw's legendary status and expressing a desire to get to know him better. Rodgers emphasized his respect for NFL legends and took the high road in his response.
title: Aaron Rodgers responds to Terry Bradshaw barbs: Sharp Steelers jibe addressed

author: FARYAL RUMI
description: Bihar's Deputy CM Samrat Choudhary received a death threat via an instant message, warning of a shooting within 24 hours. The message, sent to a party worker, prompted tightened security at Choudhary's residence and public events.
title: Cops begin probe as Bihar deputy CM Samrat Choudhary gets death threat

author: TNN
description: In Gaya, an ambulance driver and technician, employed through a private agency, are accused of raping a home guard job aspirant. The health department clarified they are not regular employees, shifting responsibility for background checks to the agency.
title: ‘Bihar rape accused hired through private firm’: Health department

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: 10-hr 'pause' in Gaza, but strikes kill 38; UAE, Jordan airdrop aid – Top developments

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: The FIDE Women's World Cup 2025 final between GM Koneru Humpy and IM Divya Deshmukh remains undecided after a second draw in their classical match in Batumi. The tense encounter saw a cautious game, leading to a repetition of moves and a stalemate. The title will now be determined in Monday's rapid tie-breaks, pitting Humpy's experience against Divya's youthful talent.
title: Chess | Women's WC final: Humpy, Divya head to tie-break after Game 2 draw

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: 'Death to Trump': EasyJet flight diverted after man's bomb threats, religious chants

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: In Scotland, US President Donald Trump and EU chief Ursula von der Leyen are engaging in trade deal talks to resolve a prolonged transatlantic dispute. Trump had earlier indicated a 50% chance of reaching an agreement before the August 1 deadline, with a 30% reciprocal tariff looming.
title: Donald Trump and EU chief begin trade deal talks in Scotland; seen as make-or-break

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Nasser Hussain criticized Ben Stokes for his "silly" reaction after Stokes seemingly protested India's refusal to accept a draw in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy match. Stokes' frustration led him to give Harry Brook the ball, which Jadeja then hit for a six to reach his century.
title: ENG vs IND: Nasser Hussain slams Ben Stokes - 'It looked silly'

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Fertility scam busted: 8 held in baby-selling scam in Hyderabad

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Gabrielle Union shared a humorous anecdote about her daughter Kaavia's obsession with marriage during a family vacation in Hawaii. Kaavia, enamored with her best friend Crosby, declared him her husband without his knowledge, leading to comical and awkward situations throughout the trip. Union highlighted Kaavia's bold personality and the family's tradition of escaping to Hawaii for Christmas.
title: Gabrielle Union on Kaavia: Daughter obsessed with marriage; Wade family vacation vibes

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: India pulled off a gritty draw at Old Trafford, with centuries from Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar sealing a remarkable escape. After being 0/2, India lost just two wickets in 143 overs, frustrating England. Shubman Gill’s century, KL Rahul’s resilience, and a determined middle-order kept India alive in the series heading into the finale at The Oval.
title: Gill, Jadeja, Washington seal gritty draw for India

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Sanjay Manjrekar criticized Ben Stokes for his conduct in offering a draw before the final hour, labeling it as behaving like a 'spoiled kid.' Jonathan Trott defended Stokes, citing common practice in England, but Manjrekar countered that the world doesn't play cricket the 'English way.
title: IND vs ENG: 'Ben Stokes behaved like a spoiled kid' - Ex-India cricketer

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Ravindra Jadeja's impressive batting performances in England continue to defy expectations, surpassing the records of Indian batting legends like Virat Kohli and VVS Laxman. His crucial half-century at Old Trafford and unbeaten partnership with Washington Sundar helped India recover from a shaky start. Jadeja's resilience and record-breaking feats solidify his status as a complete cricketer in challenging English conditions.
title: IND vs ENG: Not even Kohli! Jadeja reaches historic milestone during 4th Test

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: During the fourth Test at Old Trafford, England captain Ben Stokes offered a handshake to signal a draw, but Indian batters Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar declined, surprising Stokes. Both were approaching centuries, and India, in a dominant position, chose to continue batting. Stokes's reaction showed frustration as the game continued, highlighting India's assertive play and focus on personal milestones.
title: IND vs ENG: Stokes offers handshake to draw; but India say no - what really happened?

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: England's captain, Ben Stokes, offered a draw in the fourth Test, aiming to conserve his bowlers for an upcoming match due to fatigue. India declined, as Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar were approaching personal milestones. Jadeja later completed his century, and India's captain defended the decision, highlighting the importance of individual achievements.
title: IND vs ENG: Stokes reacts after India batters decline handshake, draw offered

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: During the fourth Test between India and England, Ben Stokes's offer to draw the match was declined by Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar, who were both approaching centuries. This unexpected refusal sparked humorous reactions online, with fans creating memes and jokes about Stokes' bewildered response. Jadeja then completed his century, adding to the drama of the match.
title: IND vs ENG: Stokes trolled after India reject draw offer; memes break internet

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Asia Cup 2025 faces political tensions after a terrorist attack in Pahalgam, even as India and Pakistan are set to clash in the tournament. Sourav Ganguly advocates for sports to continue while condemning terrorism. The tournament, featuring eight teams in the T20 format, is scheduled in UAE and will act as preparation for the upcoming T20 World Cup.
title: IND vs PAK: Ex-India skipper Ganguly on playing Pakistan in Asia Cup - 'Sport must go on'

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz issued a stark warning to Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, threatening direct retaliation if threats against Israel persist. Katz lauded the Israeli Air Force's role in Operation Rising Lion, which targeted Iranian nuclear and military infrastructure.
title: Israel's defence minister warns 'dictator' Khamenei; asks him not to threaten Israel

author: etimes.in
description: Laughter Chefs Season 2 concluded with Karan Kundrra and Elvish Yadav emerging as winners, decided by audience votes. The season was filled with unexpected twists, comedic moments from Krushna Abhishek and Sudesh Lehri, and heartwarming connections. Celebrities like Aly Goni, Nia Sharma, and Rubina Dilaik added to the entertainment, making it a memorable journey for both participants and viewers.
title: Laughter Chefs' season 2 winner: Karan Kundrra and Elvish Yadav lift the trophy

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: 'Linguistic terror': Mamata targets BJP; shares video of police 'brutality' on Bengalis

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: Ben Stokes delivered a stirring eight-over spell on Day 5 at Old Trafford, breaking a key Indian partnership and pushing through visible pain. With his shoulder aching and hamstring tight, Stokes's relentless intensity and tactical brilliance kept England in the game, reaffirming his reputation as one of the sport’s ultimate warriors.
title: One hour of Stokes in Manchester: One shoulder, one spell, one statement

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Donald Trump and Ursula von der Leyen announced a trade deal between the US and EU, aiming to resolve a prolonged transatlantic trade dispute. Trump and Ursula von der Leyen met in Scotland for crucial discussions, seeking to resolve the prolonged transatlantic trade dispute, with negotiations reaching their final stages.
title: 'Reached a deal...': Trump announces 15% tariffs on EU; calls it 'good deal for everybody'

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Russia has initiated direct commercial flights between Moscow and Pyongyang, marking a significant step in strengthening ties with North Korea. The inaugural Nordwind Airlines flight departed Moscow on Sunday, with plans for monthly service.
title: Russia starts direct flight from Moscow to North Korea's Pyongyang

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Small plane crashes off California coast: Two found unresponsive; search on for third

author: NASEER GANAI
description: Chief Justice of India B R Gavai, during his first visit to Srinagar post Article 370 abrogation, remarked on the region's beauty, quoting a Persian couplet. Speaking at a NALSA conference, he emphasized justice for all citizens and urged the J&K and Ladakh High Court to consider a separate bench for Ladakh UT, addressing the Ladakh Bar's request.
title: Srinagar a paradise, I feel at home here, says CJI

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Tata Consultancy Services plans to reduce its workforce by approximately 2%, impacting over 12,000 employees due to economic uncertainties and AI-driven technological changes. The company will provide affected staff with notice period compensation, severance benefits, insurance coverage, and outplacement assistance. This decision comes amid a slowdown in hiring across the Indian software services sector.
title: TCS layoffs: What will the IT firm do for 12,000 employees being laid off?

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: American satirist Tom Lehrer passed away at 97. He was famous for his darkly comic songs. Lehrer gained recognition in the 1950s and 60s. He was also a mathematician who taught at prestigious universities. His satirical songs tackled war, drug use, and religion. Lehrer's work remained popular through radio and stage shows. He never married and had no children.
title: Tom Lehrer dies at 97: Satirical singer found dead at home; famed for taboo-breaking songs

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: NFL star Travis Kelce faces potential fines for his signature "bow and arrow" touchdown celebration, a move recently imitated by his girlfriend, Taylor Swift, during her London concert. The NFL prohibits gestures resembling weapons, and Kelce's celebration falls under scrutiny. Several players, including Patrick Mahomes, have previously been fined for similar actions.
title: Travis Kelce vs NFL: Swift-style celebration flagged as threat; league crackdown looms

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The central government has granted 'Y' category CRPF security to Amit Jani, producer of "Udaipur Files," following alleged death threats. Jani, who heads Uttar Pradesh Navnirman Sena, expressed gratitude to PM Modi and Home Minister Shah.
title: Udaipur Files producer gets CRPF Y-category security; had alleged threats to his life

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: The US and China are likely to extend their tariff truce for another 90 days as trade negotiations continue, with discussions planned in Stockholm on Monday. During this period, both countries will refrain from new tariffs.
title: US & China may extend tariff pause by another 3 months, says report

author: LUBNA KABLY
title: USCIS draws up an implementation plan to narrow birthright citizenship

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Donald Trump visited his golf course in South Ayrshire, Scotland. Security was tight, including an armored golf cart. Protests occurred in Edinburgh and other UK cities during the visit. Demonstrators voiced opposition to Trump's politics. One protester breached security at the golf course. Trump played golf with his son Eric and ambassador Warren Stephens despite the demonstrations.
title: What is Golf Force One? Trump's armoured buggy patrols Scottish golf course

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Trisha Chatterjee, an Ohio immigration lawyer, claims an ICE officer gave her a Taco Bell number instead of assistance with urgent client cases, sparking controversy. After her TikTok video went viral, another ICE official offered help. Chatterjee highlights the broader issue of poor ICE communication, impacting immigrants facing detention and difficult bond policies, leading some to abandon their asylum claims.
title: Who is Trisha Chatterjee? Indian-origin lawyer says ICE gave Taco Bell number during crisis — video

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick announced that President Trump's reciprocal tariff deadline of August 1, 2025, will not be extended. These tariffs will be implemented, with Customs beginning to collect revenue.
title: Will the August 1 deadline be extended by Trump? What Commerce Secretary said

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat emphasized India's need to become powerful and economically strong to gain global respect, advocating for the preservation of national identity by using "Bharat" without translation. He highlighted that true education should promote sacrifice and societal contribution, extending beyond schooling to encompass the home and community environment. Bhagwat urged focus on raising responsible future generations.
title: 'World understands power': Bhagwat on why India must be 'strong and wealthy'

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Patrick Mahomes Sr., facing probation for a felony DWI charge, has received court approval to travel from Texas to Arizona. He plans to attend the Kansas City Chiefs' preseason game against the Arizona Cardinals on August 9, 2025, in Glendale. A Smith County judge granted the request, allowing Mahomes Sr. to support his son, Patrick Mahomes, at the game.
title: Patrick Mahomes Sr. vs travel ban: Court clears trip to support son; Chiefs’ Arizona clash looms

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Devendra Fadnavis downplayed any political implications of Raj Thackeray's visit to Uddhav Thackeray's residence, Matoshree, for his birthday, emphasising it as a gesture of goodwill. However, the meeting, following their joint opposition to Hindi as a medium of instruction, fuels speculation of a potential MNS-Shiv Sena (UBT) alliance for the upcoming local body elections.
title: 'Matter of happiness': Fadnavis says 'nothing political' in Raj's Matoshree visit

author: AYUSH PANDEY
description: The Thackeray cousins, Uddhav and Raj, are exploring a reunion amidst shifting political dynamics in Maharashtra, particularly with the upcoming BMC elections. Both leaders, facing challenges to their political relevance, aim to consolidate their support base. This alliance could reshape the political landscape, especially with a weakened Shinde faction and potential realignments within the NDA.
title: Uddhav-Raj bonhomie: Inside Thackeray political reset - desperate photo-op or strategic comeback?

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Shubman Gill etched his name in cricket history on Day 5 at Old Trafford, scoring his fourth century of the series against England. He joins Bradman and Gavaskar as the only captains to achieve this feat in a single series.
title: Gill equals Sunil Gavaskar and Don Bradman, leaves Virat Kohli behind

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: 'A devotee slipped': Mansa Devi temple on what led to Haridwar stampede; 6 killed, several injured

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Central Reserve Police Force will soon send commandos to Tripoli. They will protect the Indian embassy there. The embassy had reopened last July after being closed for five years. This closure was due to civil unrest. A team of 40 commandos will be led by a deputy commandant. The Ministry of External Affairs will issue clearances.
title: CRPF commandos to return to Libya; will secure Indian embassy in Tripoli

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: 'Sprayed with vinegar': Florida family arrested for abusing, drugging 9 children

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The INDIA bloc has strongly criticized the Election Commission's ongoing voter deletion process, citing opacity and flawed data. They allege that over 63 lakh voters are at risk of disenfranchisement due to inconsistencies in the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) exercise. The opposition demands an immediate halt, warning of the potential exclusion of nearly 2 crore people and threatening democratic participation.
title: SIR in Bihar: INDIA bloc slams ‘institutional arrogance’, says NDA allies also hit – Key points

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Allianz Life Insurance Company of North America faced a significant hacking incident. Hackers accessed a third-party system. They obtained personal data of many customers, financial professionals, and some employees. The company is investigating and has notified the FBI. Allianz Life is offering identity theft protection. The breach only affected Allianz Life in the US.
title: Over a million Americans data 'hacked': Allianz Life says majority of customers’ data stolen; FBI notified

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Neena Gupta, currently enjoying a career high, has always been candid about her life, including her relationship with Vivian Richards. She revealed his supportive response when she informed him about her pregnancy, despite societal disapproval of single motherhood at the time. Neena also shared her unique perspective on love, emphasizing the profound bond she shares with her daughter, Masaba.
title: Neena Gupta once recalled Vivian Richards’ reaction to her pregnancy

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Caroline Wozniacki and David Lee welcomed their third child, Max Wozniacki Lee, on July 26th. The tennis star shared a heartwarming photo of her older children, Olivia and James, cradling their new baby brother. Wozniacki hinted at the pregnancy earlier this year and her tennis future remains uncertain as she focuses on her growing family.
title: Caroline Wozniacki and David Lee welcome third child

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Hulk Hogan, the wrestling icon, passed away at 71 due to cardiac arrest, exacerbated by a demanding travel schedule following multiple surgeries. Despite doctors' recommendations for rest, Hogan continued promoting his businesses and attending events nationwide. His friend Bubba suggests this relentless pace contributed to fatal health complications, while fans speculate about a potential state funeral honoring Hogan's legacy.
title: Hulk Hogan’s death linked to hectic schedule after surgery

author: ANURAG BENDE
description: Supriya Sule alleged that approximately 14,000 men improperly benefited from the Mukhyamantri Mazhi Ladki Bahin scheme, demanding a CBI investigation into the enrollment process. Ajit Pawar responded that funds would be recovered from ineligible male beneficiaries, with strict action taken if necessary. Aditi Tatkare stated that benefits for 26.34 lakh ineligible beneficiaries, including men, have been temporarily suspended pending review.
title: Ladki Bahin scheme: 14k men got benefits, claims Sule; Ajit says will recover money if true
